title: The Krotons
dialogue_triumphs: Zoe, modestly: 'The Doctor's almost as clever as I am.'
The Doctor gets his own back: 'Zoe is something of a genius… It can be rather irritating at times.'
goofs: The first shot is of a sliding door refusing to open.
Vana's cloak falls off when she raises her arms in episode one.
Jamie collides with Zoe whilst climbing in episode one, and in the same scene her knickers are briefly visible.
Zoe's jacket is badly torn at one shoulder in episode four.
Beta is magically transported from place to place.

continuity_notes.name: TARDIS
continuity_notes.description: The Doctor's time and space machine
continuity_notes.current_status: Equipped with Hostile Action Displacement System, which activates when a Kroton attempts to destroy it

continuity_notes.name: The Doctor
continuity_notes.description: The main protagonist, a Time Lord
continuity_notes.current_status: Carrying an umbrella due to the planet's twin suns

continuity_notes.name: Zoe
continuity_notes.description: One of the Doctor's companions, known for her intelligence
continuity_notes.current_status: Demonstrating her knowledge and occasionally irritating the Doctor with her genius

continuity_notes.name: Krotons
continuity_notes.description: Crystalline aliens with a life-system based on tellurium
continuity_notes.current_status: Have been on the planet for thousands of years, part of a war fleet

continuity_notes.name: Dynatrope
continuity_notes.current_status: Transfers mental power into energy, requires 'High Brains for transfer power'

technobabble: Zoe gets tellurium's atomic number (52) correct, but is 0.4 out on its atomic weight (128 instead of 127.6).
She describes hydrogen telluride as having 'the worst smell in the world'.
roots: The Prisoner episode 'The General' (fascist educational techniques)

locations.name: Unnamed planet of the Gonds
locations.description: Planet with twin suns, rich in magnesium silicate and tellurium
locations.current_status: Inhabited by the Gonds, under the influence of the Krotons

additional_notes: Fashion Victims: Zoe in PVC. Beta has amazing sideburns.
bottom_line: 'It is not patriotism to lead people into a war they cannot win.' An acid trip! 'The Krotons' is standard 60s action material, with Jamie getting a good fight scene in episode one.
